title: Bayesian Workflow
text:
Statistics vs AI/ML
⚠️This is an oversimplified opinion.




AI is great for automating tasks that humans find easy

Driving a car
Recognizing faces, cats, and other objects
Identifying tumors on a radiology scan






Statistics is great at answering questions that humans find hard

How fast does a drug clear from the body?
What is the expected tumor size in 2 months after treatment?
How would patients respond under a different treatment?
Should I take this drug?

title: Bayesian Workflow
text:
Brief History

Thomas Bayes (1702 — 1761) was an English clergyman

title: Bayesian Workflow
text:
Statistical Models and Inferences

A model is our description of the small world that generablly contains:

A model for the conditional mean like \(X\beta\) or a differential equation describing a dynamical system
A likelihood term that contains the mean, nois
A prior model for the unkowns
